body: What version is this (on both sides)?

all nodes should be 0.9.11.
The one on the screenshot is on that version for sure since i found the original screenshot where i see the version.
Right. There's been a bunch of fixes since then, can you try the latest please?

I'm always upgrading when i see there is a new version and i only saw this once where restarting resolved it. Never seen this again since then so i have no idea if it is fixed or it can appear again...
Feel free to post your console entries as it somehow fails to spot the updates (maybe with STTRACE=all ?). You can also manually update Syncthing by redownloading it, we are at v0.9.17 already.

I have it again, this time restarting the affected node does not fix it and there are 1891 files not synced. It's the initial sync of that repo. Since there are many files I shutdown my computer during sync and when starting again the repo was in the bugged idle state. Version of all nodes is v0.9.17 now, so the bug still exists :(
since it's not fixed at a restart, what kind of logs are useful? `all` generates a bit much of data...

issue.title: panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
happened when i restarted syncthing because of bug https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/638
log: https://gist.github.com/alex2108/dd4e29bb6b9d19d5a8e1

body:
as soon as i also connected my netbook to the desktop that has the bug it started to sync the repo...

there is even more transferred from my raspberry pi which was always connected before and showed the bug. 
disconnect the netbook (kill syncthing) -> the transfer continues from the raspberry pi
restart syncthing on the desktop -> nothing is transferred from the pi and the state is idle again

next test: 
bring all nodes up -> syncing again
kill netbook -> still syncing
restart raspberry pi -> state on desktop goes to idle with needed files again

now what `STTRACE` should I activate on those nodes and upload the logs? And what tests should i do (connect node X, restart node X etc.)?

sadly not fixed by that :(
![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6099511/4435907/6f4d64fe-475d-11e4-946b-ff203f6497e8.jpg)

try to erase index or do you want any logs to be created?

Do you actually have 8 GB of data in that repo, or 14 GB?
If its 8 GB, then it could be that one of your Windows nodes is poisoning the index.

the 14 GB should be correct and no windows node ever had that repo. And like i said in the post before, as soon as i connect the the node "Netbook" it starts to sync, even the node "raspberry" sends files then.
I could "fix" it by connecting the Netbook but we could maybe find what is wrong here by leaving it in this state and maybe do some logs.

I accidently deleted the index on the node "Desktop" via a "update" to 0.9.19 which did not understand the config. After reindexing it was synced so i can't reproduce it at the moment and we can leave it closed now. Hope this will not happen again.

Hm? There's certainly no different in config or index format between 0.9.18 and 0.9.19... That said, this should all work better (or at least differently ;) in v0.10 (http://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing/).

i think the 0.9.18+32... (see screenshot from 3 days ago) already had changes that are now 0.10, otherwise i can't explain what i saw in my config :D (folder insted of repository)
I'm on v0.10 on some nodes now like you probably noticed in the bug report that you already fixed :)
Ah, right, yes, that's was before it was tagged as 0.10.
